author: Dr Ben Miles
description:
Scientists in Finland have developed the world’s largest sand battery, using 2,000 tonnes of soapstone to store thermal energy at up to 600°C for long-duration energy storage. This 100 MWh system significantly reduces district heating emissions and offers a scalable, low-cost solution for renewable energy storage independent of weather conditions.

Source Article: https://www.livescience.com/technology/engineering/a-scalding-hot-sand-battery-is-now-heating-a-small-finnish-town
